bill_title: establish a citizen's legal standing to request a writ of mandamus or prohibition.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to establish a citizen's legal standing to request a writ of mandamus or prohibition. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 12-26 be amended with a NEW SECTION: An individual registered to vote, pursuant to chapter 12-4, may file in state court a request for a writ of mandamus against any state or local official who fails or wrongly refuses to abide by or enforce state election law or rule. A request for a writ of mandamus is timely filed within thirty days of the official canvass of the votes of the election impacted by the official's failure or refusal to act. An individual registered to vote, pursuant to chapter 12-4, may file in state court a request for a writ of prohibition against any state or local official who acts outside of or without the authority of state election law or rule. A request for a writ of prohibition is timely filed within thirty days of the official canvass of the votes of the election impacted by the official's action.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
